body_content.explanation: a large amount of money, goods, property, etc.:
examples: She inherited a fortune from her grandmother.
You can make a fortune out of junk if you call it antiques.
You don't need to spend a small fortune to be prepared.
Any painting by Van Gogh is worth a fortune.

body_content.explanation: chance and the way it affects your life:
examples: He had the fortune to train with some of the world's top athletes.
They couldn't believe their good fortune.

body_content.explanation: to discover what will happen to someone in the future, for example by looking at the lines on their hands or using a special set of cards:
examples: Cast out by her parents and with nowhere to go, she meets an old woman who tells her fortune.
